definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: There is no doubt that travelling broadens one’s mind and enlarge/improve/increase one’s knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 毫无疑问，旅行使人开阔眼界，增长知识。

sentences.english: The closed-door policy of the Qing dynasty closed people's visions and minds.
sentences.chinese: 闭关锁国政策封禁了人们的眼界和思想。
哈，那可真让我开了眼界。

sentences.english: She had an eye-opening experience that night.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上，她可是开眼界了。

sentences.english: eye-opening experiences compared to the atmosphere of the other institution.
sentences.chinese: 与其他大学比起来，这里的氛围使人大开眼界。

sentences.english: And, especially for teenage girls, very eye-opening.
sentences.chinese: 而且，特别是对年轻女孩，很开眼界。

sentences.english: Fourth, I will pay a visit to some tourist attractions to widen my horizon.
sentences.chinese: 最后，我还要参观一些游览胜地，开阔眼界。

sentences.english: The delicious food of all over the world there also lets tourists get their eyes wide open.
sentences.chinese: 中外美食更是令人大开眼界，拍手叫绝。

sentences.english: This was truly an eye-opening session.
sentences.chinese: 这是真正令人大开眼界的会议。

sentences.english: That night, she had an eye-opening experience.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上，她有个眼界大开的经历。

sentences.english: Don't be no Ant-Man. An Ant-Man has very low horizons.
sentences.chinese: 不要当蚂蚁人，因为蚂蚁人的眼界很低。

sentences.english: Very few organisations have a truly international structure and perspective.
sentences.chinese: 极少数组织拥有真正国际化的结构和眼界。

sentences.english: Listening to him talk about his adventure in China was a real eye-opener.
sentences.chinese: 听他谈在中国的历险令人大开眼界。
这次经历让我大开眼界。

sentences.english: What an eye-opener it's been for me!

definition: to gain first-hand knowledge of sth/to experience for oneself/knowledge/experience/insight
one's bosom (the seat of emotions)/breast/broad-minded and open/to think about/to cherish
